problem: Alex, Stan, and Adelwolfe are trying to catch them all, Pokemon that is. Together they have caught 445 Pokemon. Alex has caught 10 more than Stan, and Stan has caught 19 less than 5 times as many as Adelwolfe has caught. How many Pokemon has Stan caught?
solution:
Let x represent the number of Pokemon Adelwolfe caught
Stan: 5x-19
Alex: 10+(5x-19)=5x-9
Total: x+5x-19+5x-9=445
11x-28=445
11x=473
x=<<43=43>>43 Pokemon
Stan:5(43)-19=196 Pokemon
#### 196

problem: Alex, Stan, and Adelwolfe are trying to catch them all, Pokemon that is. Together they have caught 261 Pokemon. Alex has caught 4 more than Stan, and Stan has caught 20 less than 4 times as many as Adelwolfe has caught. How many Pokemon has Stan caught?
solution:
Let x represent the number of Pokemon Adelwolfe caught
Stan: 4x-20
Alex: 4+(4x-20)=4x-16
Total: x+4x-20+4x-16=261
9x-36=261
9x=297
x=<<33=33>>33 Pokemon
Stan:4(33)-20=112 Pokemon

problem: Alex, Stan, and Adelwolfe are trying to catch them all, Pokemon that is. Together they have caught 236 Pokemon. Alex has caught 6 more than Stan, and Stan has caught 10 less than 2 times as many as Adelwolfe has caught. How many Pokemon has Stan caught?
solution:
Let x represent the number of Pokemon Adelwolfe caught
Stan: 2x-10
Alex: 6+(2x-10)=2x-4
Total: x+2x-10+2x-4=236
5x-14=236
5x=250
x=<<50=50>>50 Pokemon
Stan:2(50)-10=90 Pokemon
